content.text: The cells of a bacteria double itself every hour. How many cells will there be after 5 hours, if initially we start with 1 cell?

solution.text:
Initial cells = 1
The cells double itself every hour
Hence in one hour, its number would be the double of the initial cells.
Hence cells after one hour is \( (2 \times 1) \) = 2
Now cells after 2 hrs is the double of the cells after one hour.
Hence cells after 2 hours is \( (2 \times 2) \) = 4
Similarly, cells after 3 hours is \( (2 \times 4) \)=8
cells after 4 hours is \( (2 \times 8) \)=16
cells after 5 hours is \( (2 \times 16) \)=32
Thus number of cells after 5 hours is 32.
